comments.body:
Add a comment here to explain:
The added cni network config is not needed for kubenet. It is only for testing cni network plugin. But place it there for consistency and simplicity.

Actually, I feel like it's better to put cni binary and configuration into the tarball in https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e_node/remote/remote.go#L37.

And they will be unpacked to the test node automatically. I can send a PR to do that if you don't have time. :)

I didn't want to combine the CNI configuration with the CNI plugin binaries, I also thought it might be more obvious in the code as to what what the config is doing rather than refer to it by some name - that seemed more opaque to me.  If you have a strong preference to put in the tarball I can certainly do that.

Also, today the cni binaries are pulled down from  https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/network-plugins/cni-" + cniRelease + ".tar.gz.  I figured there was a good reason for this, maybe @freehan knows better than I.
